bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, November 8, 1898

div1.p: Lawrence Reed says he will be sent to Cuba with his military unit.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Walter Reed, November 8, 1898
div1.p:
I hope you will not
think hard of me for not writing
any sooner, but real for the time
I forgot I owed you a letter. Then
I have been working so hard that
the time simply flies, and I never
can keep up with the days. I suppose
you have heard that the 2nd delivery
has been assigned to the 7th Army
Corps and will go to Havana Cuba
as yet we havent the slighest idea
when we will go, What do you think of
that? Well Dad I am getting in
some go licks of study since I have
returned and if we remain here
all winter I hope to accomplish a great
deal, Give me an idea, what to read, etc.
The wether here is perfectly delightful
and I play foot ball every afternoon
for about an hour, it is about
The only exercise I am able to get
in, Did you know that Helen
Heares is engaged to be married I was
up to see Mrs W, Miss N. and the
Col had quite a nice time
As I want to get this off on the
boat I will close
div1.closer:
Love to all from your
aff son Lawrence Give me all the good news you know
